channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A two-run lead was starting to slip away from the Los Angeles Dodgers in the ninth inning — along with their chance to force the World Series to Game 7.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 2025 Silver Pigskin Fan Vote
item.description: SAN DIEGO -- For nearly 30 years, the Prep Pigskin Report has awarded the top prize in high school sports at the annual Silver Pigskin Gala. The Red Jacket Select Committee has made their selections for the first four nominees, and now it's up to YOU to choose the fifth.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Stone, Fox 5

item.title: Double trouble: Barger gets caught off second base as Blue Jays' rally fizzles in Game 6 of Series
item.description: With the Toronto Blue Jays trying to mount a ninth-inning rally, Addison Barger got doubled off second base to end Game 6 of the World Series.
item.dc:creator: Rob Gillies, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts says Shohei Ohtani a possibility to start Game 7 of World Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani might start Game 7 of the World Series on Saturday. Tyler Glasnow might pitch on back-to-back days. For Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts, the only certainty is that Yoshinobu Yamamoto won't pitch. Besides that? "Everyone will be available," Roberts said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: By RONALD BLUM TORONTO (AP) — Yoshinobu Yamamoto beat Toronto for the second time in a week, slumping Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in a three-run third inning and the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers held off the Blue Jays 3-1 on Friday night to force the World Series to a decisive
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, The Mercury News

item.title: Brian Kelly faces harsh criticism from LSU football staffers after dismissal
item.description: Brian Kelly’s tenure at LSU ended in disappointment, and staff members accuse the former coach of poor relationships and a failure to grasp team culture.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps: 'We are trying our hardest' to settle antitrust lawsuit
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — NASCAR Commissioner Steve Phelps said Friday “we are trying our hardest” to settle the federal antitrust lawsuit with the two teams suing the racing series in the most expansive comments yet from the defendants.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Jaguars' Travis Hunter surprisingly lands on injured reserve; coach noncommittal about return for this season
item.description: Travis Hunter sustained a noncontact knee injury during practice this week, leaving head coach Liam Coen unsure whether he will return this season.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Jaguars place two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve with a right knee injury
item.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — The Jacksonville Jaguars placed two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve Friday because of a knee injury. Coach Liam Coen announced the move a day after Hunter injured his right knee in practice.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: NFL cracks down on Ravens with major fine tied to Lamar Jackson injury report
item.description: The NFL reportedly fined the Baltimore Ravens $100,000 for violating the league's injury report policy last week involving star quarterback Lamar Jackson.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against Seahawks on Sunday night
item.description: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Washington quarterback Jayden Daniels will start for the Commanders against the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday night. Daniels, hampered by an injured right hamstring, missed his third game of the season on Monday night when the Commanders fell 28-7 to the Kansas City Chiefs.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Zverev saves match points to set up Sinner semifinal at Paris Masters
item.description: Alexander Zverev has saved two match points to overcame Daniil Medvedev 2-6, 6-3, 7-6 and keep alive his Paris Masters title defense.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Miami Dolphins and General Manager Chris Grier agree to part ways
item.description: The Miami Dolphins and Chris Grier have agreed to part ways, ending his 10-year tenure as general manager.
item.dc:creator: Alanis Thames, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Chauncey Billups hires Trump's former attorney for federal gambling probe investigation
item.description: Los Angeles Clippers coach Chauncey Billups has hired Trump’s former lawyer to represent him in the case of alleged involvement in rigged poker games.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Blue Jays 1 win away from ending 32-year World Series championship drought
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from capturing their first World Series title in 32 years and will take on the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 6 of the Fall Classic on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Jonas Williams, Trey Serauskis aim to lead Lincoln-Way East to IHSA state title
item.description: FRANKFORT, Ill. - His last name is Williams. He's a five-star quarterback and he’s headed to USC to play for Lincoln Riley. No, not that Williams. But, Lincoln-Way East star Jonas Williams does see some similarities between himself and the Bears signal caller with the same number.
item.dc:creator: Josh Frydman, WGN 9

item.title: Ravens’ Lamar Jackson lights up Dolphins with 4 TDs in dominant return from injury
item.description: Lamar Jackson threw four touchdown passes in his return from injury as the Baltimore Ravens dominated the Miami Dolphins on "Thursday Night Football" with Mark Andrews scoring twice.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: WNBA and players union agree to 30-day extension for CBA negotiations, AP source says
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The WNBA and players union have agreed to a 30-day extension to continue negotiations for a new collective bargaining agreement, a person familiar with the decision said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: DOUG FEINBERG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Athlete of the Week: Cambelle Brammer
item.description: FRUITA, Colo. (KREX) – Cambelle Brammer is the KREX EXceptional student athlete of the week. She had 96 kills and 94 digs over her last five matches for the Fruita volleyball team. "I'm pretty competitive.
item.dc:creator: Jackson Cowen, KREX 5

item.title: Sting to headline Super Bowl concert in SF two days ahead of game
item.description: The NFL's hospitality provider, On Location, announced the Super Bowl LX Studio 60 concert on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation

item.title: Jason Kreis named RSL President of Soccer Operations
item.description: SANDY, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Jason Kreis has a new role with Real Salt Lake. The former RSL player and head coach was named the team's President of Soccer Operations. Kreis returned to Real Salt Lake nearly two years ago as the team's Director of Club Operations and Special Projects.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Utah's 7-game winning streak ends with 6-3 loss to Oilers
item.description: EDMONTON (ABC4 Sports) - Connor McDavid scored two goals for the Edmonton Oilers, who ended the Utah Mammoth's seven-game winning streak with a 6-3 come-from-behind victory at Rogers Place on Tuesday. This was Utah's first loss since October 13th.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Kucherov gets 1,000th career point in Lightning's game against Ducks
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Nikita Kucherov became the third-fastest active player to reach the 1,000-point club, reaching the milestone Saturday in the Tampa Bay Lightning's 4-3 win against the Anaheim Ducks. Kucherov finished with two assists and reached milestone in his 809th career game.
item.dc:creator: ERIK ERLENDSSON, Associated Press, Fox 5
